, England]] 'Traffic lights,' also known as 'traffic signals, traffic lamps,'
'signal lights',
'robots' [http://www.mydriverslicence.co.za/driving_%20road_signs.htm The
meaning of traffic lights/red green and amber robots â South Africa].
Mydriverslicence.co.za. and 'semaphores'., [http://www.techtransfer.berkeley.edu/newsletter/07-
4/traffic_signals.php A Brief History of Traffic Signals- UC Berkeley].
Techtransfer.berkeley.edu. are signalling devices positioned at or near
road intersections, pedestrian crossings and other locations to control
competing flows of traffic. Traffic lights were first installed in 1868 in
London, United
Kingdom; [http://www.dcsc.tudelft.nl/~bdeschutter/pub/rep/06_044.pdf
Anticiperende netwerkregelingen]. (PDF). now used in almost every city of
the world. Traffic lights alternate the right of way accorded to road users by
displaying lights of a standard color (red, yellow/amber, and green) following a
universal color code (and a precise sequence to enable comprehension by those
who are color blind).

In the typical sequence of color phases:
* Illumination of the green light allows traffic to proceed in the direction
  denoted, if it is safe to do so
* Illumination of the yellow/amber light denoting prepare to stop short of the
  intersection, if it is safe to do so
* Illumination of the red signal prohibits any traffic from proceeding

Usually, the red light contains some orange in its hue, and the green light
contains some blue, said to be for the benefit of people with red-green color
blindness.
headings: US Department of Transportation Manual of Uniform Traffic Control Devices
